### startsWithGlobalOffsetTable() {#a3e9dd2df270e8ff9b688dc40af18e54e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static GlobalOffsetTableExprKind startsWithGlobalOffsetTable (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; Expr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if this expression starts with <em>GLOBAL&#95;OFFSET&#95;TABLE</em> and if it is of the form <em>GLOBAL&#95;OFFSET&#95;TABLE</em>-symbol.

This is needed to support PIC on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf">ELF</a> i386 as <em>GLOBAL&#95;OFFSET&#95;TABLE</em> is magical. We check only simple case that are know to be used: <em>GLOBAL&#95;OFFSET&#95;TABLE</em> by itself or at the start of a binary expression.

Definition at line <a href="#l00463">463</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/mctargetdesc/x86mccodeemitter-cpp">X86MCCodeEmitter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IsAdSize16 || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86-mc/#a4c4cc9236e2a4f99e7e616a7f6740f16">X86&#95;MC::is16BitMemOperand</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, STI)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BaseReg) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For 32-bit addressing, the row and column values in Table 2-2 are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// basically the same. It&#39;s AX/CX/DX/BX/SP/BP/SI/DI in that order, with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// some special cases. And getX86RegNum reflects that numbering.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For 16-bit addressing it&#39;s more fun, as shown in the SDM Vol 2A,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Table 2-1 &quot;16-Bit Addressing Forms with the ModR/M byte&quot;. We can only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use SI/DI/BP/BX, which have &quot;row&quot; values 4-7 in no particular order,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// while values 0-3 indicate the allowed combinations (base+index) of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// those: 0 for BX+SI, 1 for BX+DI, 2 for BP+SI, 3 for BP+DI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// R16Table&#91;&#93; is a lookup from the normal RegNo, to the row values from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Table 2-1 for 16-bit addressing modes. Where zero means disallowed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> R16Table&#91;&#93; = &#123;0, 0, 0, 7, 0, 6, 4, 5&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RMfield = R16Table&#91;BaseRegNo&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(RMfield &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;invalid 16-bit base register&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IndexReg.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcoperand/#a94abf618eb8001b802910ab872a7d1d9">getReg</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IndexReg16 = R16Table&#91;getX86RegNum(IndexReg)&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(IndexReg16 &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;invalid 16-bit index register&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We must have one of SI/DI (4,5), and one of BP/BX (6,7).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(((IndexReg16 ^ RMfield) &amp; 2) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="normal">               </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;invalid 16-bit base/index register combination&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Scale.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcoperand/#a4509c43893edc940979f690c468664c1">getImm</a>() == 1 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="normal">               </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;invalid scale for 16-bit memory reference&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Allow base/index to appear in either order (although GAS doesn&#39;t).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IndexReg16 &amp; 2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal">          RMfield = (RMfield &amp; 1) | ((7 - IndexReg16) &lt;&lt; 1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="normal">          RMfield = (IndexReg16 &amp; 1) | ((7 - RMfield) &lt;&lt; 1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// AVX instructions are encoded using an encoding scheme that combines</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// prefix bytes, opcode extension field, operand encoding fields, and vector</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// length encoding capability into a new prefix, referred to as VEX.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The majority of the AVX-512 family of instructions (operating on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 512/256/128-bit vector register operands) are encoded using a new prefix</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (called EVEX).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XOP is a revised subset of what was originally intended as SSE5. It was</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// changed to be similar but not overlapping with AVX.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Emit XOP, VEX2, VEX3 or EVEX prefix.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\returns the used prefix.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
